entry.title: What is Domain Name?
entry.summary:
Summary Domain names are a key part of the Internet infrastructure. They provide a human-readable address for any web server available on the Internet.
Any Internet-connected computer can be reached through a public IP address, either an IPv4 address (e.g. 173.194.121.32) or an IPv6 address (e.g., 2027:0da8:8b73:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:1337).
Computers can handle such addresses easily, but people...

entry.title: How The Web Works?
entry.summary:
How The Web Works? How the web works provides a simplified view of what happens when you view a webpage in a web browser on your computer or phone.
This theory is not essential to writing web code in the short term, but before long you’ll really start to benefit from understanding what’s happening in the background. Clients and servers Computers connected to the internet are called clients and...

entry.title: How Does the Internet Work?
entry.summary: Summary The Internet is the backbone of the Web, the technical infrastructure that makes the Web possible. At its most basic, the Internet is a large network of computers which communicate all together. History of Internet in Short It began in the 1960s as a US-army-funded research project, then evolved into a public infrastructure in the 1980s with the support of many public universities and p...
